member.param: a Dictionary value
member.returns: a string[] value

member.name: T:SharpEntropy.BasicContextGenerator
member.summary:
Generate contexts for maxent decisions, assuming that the input given to the GetContext() method is a string containing contextual predicates separated by spaces, e.g:
cp_1 cp_2 ... cp_n
member.author: Jason Baldridge
Richard J. Northedge

member.name: T:SharpEntropy.IContextGenerator`1
member.summary: Generate contexts for maximum entropy decisions.

member.name: M:SharpEntropy.IContextGenerator`1.GetContext(`0)
member.summary: Builds up the list of contextual predicates given an object of type T.

member.name: M:SharpEntropy.BasicContextGenerator.GetContext(System.String)
member.summary: Builds up the list of contextual predicates given a string.
member.param: string with contextual predicates separated by spaces.
member.returns: string array of contextual predicates.

member.name: T:SharpEntropy.BasicEventReader
member.summary:
An object which can deliver a stream of training events assuming that each event is represented as a space separated list containing all the contextual predicates, with the last item being the outcome, e.g.:
cp_1 cp_2 ... cp_n outcome

member.name: T:SharpEntropy.ITrainingEventReader
member.summary: An object which can deliver a stream of training events for the GIS procedure (or others such as IIS if and when they are implemented). TrainingEventReaders don't need to use SharpEntropy.ITrainingDataReader, but doing so would provide greater flexibility for producing events from data stored in different formats.

member.name: M:SharpEntropy.ITrainingEventReader.ReadNextEvent
member.summary: Returns the next TrainingEvent object held in this TrainingEventReader.
member.returns: the TrainingEvent object which is next in this TrainingEventReader

member.name: M:SharpEntropy.ITrainingEventReader.HasNext
member.summary: Test whether there are any TrainingEvents remaining in this TrainingEventReader.
member.returns: true if this TrainingEventReader has more TrainingEvents

member.name: M:SharpEntropy.BasicEventReader.#ctor(SharpEntropy.ITrainingDataReader{System.String})
member.summary: Constructor sets up the training event reader based on a stream of training data.
member.param: Stream of training data.

member.name: M:SharpEntropy.BasicEventReader.ReadNextEvent
member.summary: Returns the next Event object held in this EventReader. Each call to ReadNextEvent advances the EventReader.
member.returns: the Event object which is next in this EventReader

member.name: M:SharpEntropy.BasicEventReader.HasNext
member.summary: Test whether there are any Events remaining in this EventReader.
member.returns: true if this EventReader has more Events

member.name: T:SharpEntropy.GisModel
member.summary: A maximum entropy model which has been trained using the Generalized Iterative Scaling procedure.
member.author: Tom Morton and Jason Baldridge
Richard J. Northedge

member.name: T:SharpEntropy.IMaximumEntropyModel
member.summary: Interface for maximum entropy models.
member.author: Jason Baldridge
Richard J. Northedge

member.name: M:SharpEntropy.IMaximumEntropyModel.Evaluate(System.String[])
member.summary: Evaluates a context.
member.param: A list of string names of the contextual predicates which are to be evaluated together.
member.returns: An array of the probabilities for each of the different outcomes, all of which sum to 1.

member.name: M:SharpEntropy.IMaximumEntropyModel.Evaluate(System.String[],System.Double[])
member.summary: Evaluates a context.
member.param: A list of string names of the contextual predicates which are to be evaluated together.
An array which is populated with the probabilities for each of the different outcomes, all of which sum to 1.
member.returns: an array of the probabilities for each of the different outcomes, all of which sum to 1. The probabilities array is returned if it is appropiately sized.

member.name: M:SharpEntropy.IMaximumEntropyModel.GetBestOutcome(System.Double[])
member.summary: Simple function to return the outcome associated with the index containing the highest probability in the double[].
member.param: A double[] as returned by the Evaluate(string[] context) method.
member.returns: the string name of the best outcome

member.name: M:SharpEntropy.IMaximumEntropyModel.GetAllOutcomes(System.Double[])
member.summary: Return a string matching all the outcome names with all the probabilities produced by the eval(string[] context) method.
member.param: A double[] as returned by the eval(string[] context) method.
member.returns: string containing outcome names paired with the normalized probability (contained in the double[] ocs) for each one.

member.name: M:SharpEntropy.IMaximumEntropyModel.GetOutcomeName(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets the string name of the outcome associated with the supplied index
member.param: the index for which the name of the associated outcome is desired.
member.returns: the string name of the outcome

member.name: M:SharpEntropy.IMaximumEntropyModel.GetOutcomeIndex(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the index associated with the string name of the given outcome.
member.param: the string name of the outcome for which the index is desired
member.returns: the index if the given outcome label exists for this model, -1 if it does not.

member.name: P:SharpEntropy.IMaximumEntropyModel.OutcomeCount
member.summary: Returns the number of outcomes for this model.
member.returns: The number of outcomes.

member.name: M:SharpEntropy.GisModel.#ctor(SharpEntropy.IO.IGisModelReader)
member.summary: Constructor for a maximum entropy model trained using the Generalized Iterative Scaling procedure.
member.param: A reader providing the data for the model.

member.name: M:SharpEntropy.GisModel.Evaluate(System.String[])
member.summary: Evaluates a context.
member.param: A list of string names of the contextual predicates which are to be evaluated together.
member.returns: An array of the probabilities for each of the different outcomes, all of which sum to 1.

member.name: M:SharpEntropy.GisModel.Evaluate(System.String[],System.Double[])
member.summary: Use this model to evaluate a context and return an array of the likelihood of each outcome given that context.
member.param: The names of the predicates which have been observed at the present decision point.
This is where the distribution is stored.
member.returns: The normalized probabilities for the outcomes given the context. The indexes of the double[] are the outcome ids, and the actual string representation of the outcomes can be obtained from the method GetOutcome(int outcomeIndex).

member.name: M:SharpEntropy.GisModel.GetBestOutcome(System.Double[])
member.summary: Return the name of the outcome corresponding to the highest likelihood in the parameter outcomes.
member.param: A double[] as returned by the Evaluate(string[] context) method.
member.returns: The name of the most likely outcome.

member.name: M:SharpEntropy.GisModel.GetAllOutcomes(System.Double[])
member.summary: Return a string matching all the outcome names with all the probabilities produced by the Evaluate(string[] context) method.
member.param: A double[] as returned by the eval(string[] context) method.
member.returns: string containing outcome names paired with the normalized probability (contained in the double[] outcomes) for each one.

member.name: M:SharpEntropy.GisModel.GetOutcomeName(System.Int32)
member.summary: Return the name of an outcome corresponding to an integer ID value.
member.param: An outcome ID.
member.returns: The name of the outcome associated with that ID.

member.summary: Gets the index associated with the string name of the given outcome.
member.param: the string name of the outcome for which the index is desired
member.returns: the index if the given outcome label exists for this model, -1 if it does not.

member.returns: Dictionary containing PatternedPredicate objects.

member.name: M:SharpEntropy.GisModel.GetOutcomePatterns
member.summary: Provides the list of outcome patterns used by the predicates. This method will usually only be needed by GisModelWriters.
member.returns: Array of outcome patterns.

member.name: M:SharpEntropy.GisModel.GetOutcomeNames
member.summary: Provides the outcome names data structure which is part of the encoding of the maxent model information. This method will usually only be needed by GisModelWriters.
member.returns: Array containing the outcome names.

member.name: P:SharpEntropy.GisModel.OutcomeCount
member.summary: Returns the number of outcomes for this model.
member.returns: The number of outcomes.

member.name: P:SharpEntropy.GisModel.CorrectionConstant
member.summary: Provides the model's correction constant. This property will usually only be needed by GisModelWriters.

member.name: P:SharpEntropy.GisModel.CorrectionParameter
member.summary: Provides the model's correction parameter. This property will usually only be needed by GisModelWriters.

member.name: T:SharpEntropy.GisTrainer
member.summary: An implementation of Generalized Iterative Scaling. The reference paper for this implementation was Adwait Ratnaparkhi's tech report at the University of Pennsylvania's Institute for Research in Cognitive Science, and is available at ftp://ftp.cis.upenn.edu/pub/ircs/tr/97-08.ps.Z.
member.author: Jason Baldridge
Richard J, Northedge

member.name: T:SharpEntropy.IO.IGisModelReader
member.summary: Interface for readers of GIS models.

member.name: M:SharpEntropy.IO.IGisModelReader.GetOutcomeLabels
member.summary: Returns the model's outcome labels as a string array. This method should usually only be accessed by GIS model writer classes via the GisModel class.

member.name: M:SharpEntropy.IO.IGisModelReader.GetOutcomePatterns
member.summary: Returns the model's outcome patterns. This method should usually only be accessed by GIS model writer classes via the GisModel class.

member.name: M:SharpEntropy.IO.IGisModelReader.GetPredicates
member.summary: Returns the model's predicates. This method should usually only be accessed by GIS model writer classes via the GisModel class.

member.name: M:SharpEntropy.IO.IGisModelReader.GetPredicateData(System.String,System.Int32[],System.Double[])
member.summary: Returns model information for a predicate, given the predicate label.
member.param: The predicate label to fetch information for.
Array to be passed in to the method; it should have a length equal to the number of outcomes in the model. The method increments the count of each outcome that is active in the specified predicate.
Array to be passed in to the method; it should have a length equal to the number of outcomes in the model. The method adds the parameter values for each of the active outcomes in the predicate.

member.name: P:SharpEntropy.IO.IGisModelReader.CorrectionConstant
member.summary: Returns the value of the model's correction constant. This property should usually only be accessed by GIS model writer classes via the GisModel class.

member.name: P:SharpEntropy.IO.IGisModelReader.CorrectionParameter
member.summary: Returns the value of the model's correction constant parameter. This property should usually only be accessed by GIS model writer classes via the GisModel class.

Array to be passed in to the method; it should have a length equal to the number of outcomes in the model. The method increments the count of each outcome that is active in the specified predicate.

member.name: E:SharpEntropy.GisTrainer.TrainingProgress
member.summary: Used to provide informational messages regarding the progress of the training algorithm.

member.name: P:SharpEntropy.GisTrainer.Smoothing
member.summary: Sets whether this trainer will use smoothing while training the model. This can improve model accuracy, though training will potentially take longer and use more memory. Model size will also be larger.
member.remarks: Initial testing indicates improvements for models built on small data sets and few outcomes, but performance degradation for those with large data sets and lots of outcomes.

member.name: P:SharpEntropy.GisTrainer.UseSlackParameter
member.summary: Sets whether this trainer will use slack parameters while training the model.

member.name: P:SharpEntropy.GisTrainer.SmoothingObservation
member.summary: If smoothing is in use, this value indicates the "number" of times we want the trainer to imagine that it saw a feature that it actually didn't see. Defaulted to 0.1.

member.summary: The correction constant for the model produced as a result of training.

member.name: P:SharpEntropy.GisTrainer.CorrectionParameter
member.summary: The correction parameter for the model produced as a result of training.

member.summary: Compare two outcome patterns and determines which comes first, based on the outcome ids (lower outcome ids first)

Second outcome pattern to compare.

member.name: T:SharpEntropy.IO.BinaryGisModelReader
member.summary: A reader for GIS models stored in a binary format. This format is not the one used by the java version of MaxEnt. It has two main differences, designed for performance when loading the data from file: first, it uses big endian data values, which is native for C#, and secondly it encodes the outcome patterns and values in a more efficient manner.
member.author: Jason Baldridge
Richard J. Northedge

member.name: T:SharpEntropy.IO.GisModelReader
member.summary: Abstract parent class for readers of GIS models.
member.author: Jason Baldridge
Richard J. Northedge

member.name: M:SharpEntropy.IO.GisModelReader.ReadModel
member.summary:
Retrieve a model from disk.
This method delegates to worker methods for each part of this sequence. If you are creating a reader that conforms largely to this sequence but varies at one or more points, override the relevant worker method(s) to achieve the required format.
If you are creating a reader for a format which does not follow this sequence at all, override this method and ignore the other ReadX methods provided in this abstract class.
member.remarks:
Thie method assumes that models are saved in the following sequence:
GIS (model type identifier)
1. the correction constant (int)
2. the correction constant parameter (double)
3. outcomes
3a. number of outcomes (int)
3b. outcome names (string array - length specified in 3a)
4. predicates
4a. outcome patterns
4ai. number of outcome patterns (int)
4aii. outcome pattern values (each stored in a space delimited string)
4b. predicate labels
4bi. number of predicates (int)
4bii. predicate names (string array - length specified in 4bi)
4c. predicate parameters (double values)

member.name: M:SharpEntropy.IO.GisModelReader.CheckModelType
member.summary: Checks the model file being read from begins with the sequence of characters "GIS".

Array to be passed in to the method; it should have a length equal to the number of outcomes in the model. The method increments the count of each outcome that is active in the specified predicate.
Array to be passed in to the method; it should have a length equal to the number of outcomes in the model. The method adds the parameter values for each of the active outcomes in the predicate.

Dictionary that will contain the predicate information for the model after this method is called.

member.name: T:SharpEntropy.IO.BinaryGisModelWriter
member.summary: A writer for GIS models that saves models in a binary format. This format is not the one used by the java version of MaxEnt. It has two main differences, designed for performance when loading the data from file: first, it uses big endian data values, which is native for C#, and secondly it encodes the outcome patterns and values in a more efficient manner.
member.author: Jason Baldridge
Richard J. Northedge

member.name: T:SharpEntropy.IO.GisModelWriter
member.summary: Abstract parent class for GIS model writers that save data to a single file. It provides the persist method which takes care of the structure of a stored document, and requires an extending class to define precisely how the data should be stored.
member.author: Jason Baldridge
Richard J. Northedge

member.name: M:SharpEntropy.IO.GisModelWriter.WriteString(System.String)
member.summary: Implement as needed for the format the model is stored in.
member.param: string data to be written to storage.

member.name: M:SharpEntropy.IO.GisModelWriter.WriteInt32(System.Int32)
member.summary: Implement as needed for the format the model is stored in.
member.param: Integer data to be written to storage.

member.name: M:SharpEntropy.IO.GisModelWriter.WriteDouble(System.Double)
member.summary: Implement as needed for the format the model is stored in.
member.param: Double precision floating point data to be written to storage.

member.name: M:SharpEntropy.IO.GisModelWriter.GetPredicates
member.summary: Obtains a list of the predicates in the model to be written to storage.
member.returns: Array of PatternedPredicate objects containing the predicate data for the model.

member.name: M:SharpEntropy.IO.GisModelWriter.SetPredicates(SharpEntropy.PatternedPredicate[])
member.summary: Sets the list of predicates to be written to storage.
member.param: Array of PatternedPredicate objects to be persisted.

member.name: M:SharpEntropy.IO.GisModelWriter.Persist(SharpEntropy.GisModel)
member.summary:
Writes the model to persistent storage, using the writeX() methods provided by extending classes.
This method delegates to worker methods for each part of this sequence. If you are creating a writer that conforms largely to this sequence but varies at one or more points, override the relevant worker method(s) to achieve the required format.
If you are creating a writer for a format which does not follow this sequence at all, override this method and ignore the other WriteX methods provided in this abstract class.
member.param: GIS model whose data is to be persisted.

member.name: M:SharpEntropy.IO.GisModelWriter.Initialize(SharpEntropy.GisModel)
member.summary: Organises the data available in the GIS model into a structure that is easier to persist from.
member.param: The GIS model to be persisted.

member.name: T:SharpEntropy.IO.JavaBinaryGisModelReader
member.summary: A reader for GIS models stored in the binary format produced by the java version of MaxEnt. This binary format stores data using big-endian values, which means that the C# version must reverse the byte order of each value in turn, making it less efficient. Use only for compatibility with the java MaxEnt library.
member.author: Jason Baldridge
Richard J. Northedge

member.name: M:SharpEntropy.IO.JavaBinaryGisModelReader.#ctor(System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Constructor which directly instantiates the Stream containing the model contents.
member.param: The Stream containing the model information.

member.name: M:SharpEntropy.IO.JavaBinaryGisModelReader.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Constructor which takes a filename and creates a reader for it.
member.param: The full path and name of the file in which the model is stored.

member.name: M:SharpEntropy.IO.JavaBinaryGisModelReader.ReadInt32
member.summary: Reads a 32-bit signed integer from the model file.

member.name: M:SharpEntropy.IO.JavaBinaryGisModelReader.ReadDouble
member.summary: Reads a double-precision floating point number from the model file.

member.name: M:SharpEntropy.IO.JavaBinaryGisModelReader.ReadString
member.summary: Reads a UTF-8 encoded string from the model file.

This binary format stores data using big-endian values, which means that the C# version must reverse the byte order of each value in turn, making it less efficient. Use only for compatibility with the java MaxEnt library.

member.name: T:SharpEntropy.ITrainingDataReader`1
member.summary: A interface for objects which can deliver a stream of training data to be supplied to an ITrainingEventReader. It is not necessary to use a ITrainingDataReader in a SharpEntropy application, but it can be used to support a wider variety of formats in which your training data can be held.
member.author: Jason Baldridge
Richard J. Northedge

member.name: M:SharpEntropy.ITrainingDataReader`1.NextToken
member.summary: Returns the next slice of data held in this ITrainingDataReader.
member.returns: the object representing the data which is next in this ITrainingDataReader

member.name: M:SharpEntropy.ITrainingDataReader`1.HasNext
member.summary: Test whether there are any training data items remaining in this ITrainingDataReader.
member.returns: true if this ITrainingDataReader has more data tokens

member.name: T:SharpEntropy.OnePassDataIndexer
member.summary: An indexer for maxent model data which handles cutoffs for uncommon contextual predicates and provides a unique integer index for each of the predicates. The data structures built in the constructor of this class are used by the GIS trainer.
member.author: Jason Baldridge
Richard J. Northedge

member.name: M:SharpEntropy.OnePassDataIndexer.#ctor(SharpEntropy.ITrainingEventReader)
member.summary: One argument constructor for OnePassDataIndexer which calls the two argument constructor assuming no cutoff.
member.param: An ITrainingEventReader which contains the a list of all the Events seen in the training data.

member.name: M:SharpEntropy.OnePassDataIndexer.#ctor(SharpEntropy.ITrainingEventReader,System.Int32)
member.summary: Two argument constructor for OnePassDataIndexer.
member.param: An ITrainingEventReader which contains the a list of all the Events seen in the training data.
The minimum number of times a predicate must have been observed in order to be included in the model.

member.name: M:SharpEntropy.OnePassDataIndexer.ComputeEventCounts(SharpEntropy.ITrainingEventReader,System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary{System.String,System.Int32},System.Int32)
member.summary: Reads events from eventReader into a List<TrainingEvent>. The predicates associated with each event are counted and any which occur at least cutoff times are added to the predicatesInOut dictionary along with a unique integer index.
member.param: an ITrainingEventReader value
a Dictionary value
an int value
member.returns: an List of TrainingEvents value
